TextView.android:text: \tWhen you start your first level, you will be greeted with this screen:

The first thing you'll notice is the user interface. The grey circle on the left is a joypad.You can touch it with your thumb to move.

	On the right, there are two buttons, A and B. Press A to shoot. When you do, the blue energy bar on the top right will lower. 

	If that bar is empty, you will not be able to shoot anymore. You can replenish it with pickups dropped by enemies. The red bar is health.

The B button is a little more complicated. It will allow you to pick up blocks and balls, the pinkish things you see on the ground; just go up to one and press B.

	When holding a block or ball, you can walk around with it, but cannot shoot.

	Now that you have an object picked up, you have two choices. Press B again to drop the object, A to shoot it out. It will bounce around and eventually stop, though some objects may bounce indefinitely.

\tSo now you can use the buttons! But what for? Well, see the pressure plates in the above pictures? They're the red circles on the ground. Dropping the objects on top of them will press them down.\n\n\tWhen you press them, stuff happens. For example:
\tSee, the door has opened! Pressure plates are very important in the game. So now, when we approach the open door, this thing comes out at us:

\tOh noes! That microchip thing is an EVIL microchip. It will kill you when you get close enough, so you must vanquish it with your mighty A button.\n\n\tOnce you've killed it, a door further ahead will open.
\tWalk through that space, and you will be back to the level select screen! Another level will be unlocked, now go and beat it!
